content: There are points of concern regarding Abu Ghraib. Were prisoners mistreated as punishment? Or to find a reason to keep them there? Confessions? Were the prisoners identified as high value targets possessing vital info? Were any guards into it for their jollies? There may be wrong things they did for all the wrong reasons. That would fall into the responsibility of their command and their own personal responsibilities. That said. Considering circumstances, training, and location, I am of a more forgiving nature. Those that assuredly knew better should have a price to pay. Just not yet. Not to us. They may have been doing what they thought we all expected them to do.
